name: Stirling, Cooper, Draper, Price
description:
Hybridized my SCDP deck with some Retired Motivational Speaker seminars, and this is the result!

This deck is really weird, and I don't have a huge range of experience with it. It has crushed Weyland's face, but I've yet to face CI or NBN FA builds with it, so I wouldn't say it's a finished product.

Iain is an interesting runner: he wants to get behind while he builds board position and an unassailable pile of money (I've generated a 30c+ bank in every game so far), and then when it is danger-zone time he goes into glacially-paced go mode.

More testing is definitely in order here.

name: Magic Missiles
description: Resuscitating the spellslinger-in-chief. This freakin' guy can mess with any corp's econ plans.

name: Blue Sun: High Threat Response
description: Why should you ever care about Bad Publicity when you have an Elizabeth Mills Reputation Engine at your disposal?

name: Philotic Pain
description: What is going on here? Why so many agendas? Why so much pain? Everything hurts here...and the runner will suffer to get a single agenda point. More agendas in his score area, more dangerous Philotic Entanglemnt gets. Forces him to add some Shi.Kyu there and we are in for a threat. You dont have too much eco cards because you dont need. Score what you can fast, go crazy in remotes, lay traps and always try to put these future perfects in your archives. NEVER INSTALL IT. Go, and kill the pesky runner.

name: Rushy stuff
Fishing in Harmony 1.2
description: Lets try this: 6 agendas and you only have to score 2 of them. With Shi.Kyū, the runner has to steal 3. A lot of work in a 44 cards deck. Caution: Dont get R&D-locked.

name: The Smiling Bandit [Strikes again!/Ha-Ha-Ha] v1.4
HM: 6 pointer ice control
description:
Try to control game with money and Jinteki tricks. I want to give Jinteki personalities an oportunity to prove themselves, with lots of ice tricks to defend yourself.

I don't know if I should use more copies of each one, I must test it yet. This concept is insipired from "Healing Your Brain with Harmony 1.0", but takes a different approach.

http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/5769/healing-your-brain-with-harmony-1-0

name: Over and Out v1.1
description:
I've been tuning my Chaos Theory Overmind deck, and this version seems much more effective than the previous one.

Spent my influence rather differently this time, with the only out-of-faction IB being a Femme Fatale, which can easily solve most problematic situations (Wraparound, Swordsman, Ice Wall / Hadrian's Wall, etc...).

Added Ice Carver to save tons of money in the long run, and 2 copies of Legwork because early multi-access on HQ can be brutal. Switched from TME to Indexing because it's a more all-around card and not accessing means no risk against Jinteki.

name: Tennis Institute + Hass Archology
description:
Current version of a deck based on exploiting the tennis institute's ability to put advancement counters on cards that shouldn't be advanceable. Like, say, Haas Arcology AI. You then roll that into scoring cards out of your hand and play a game of fast advance.

Usually the Archology attracts a lot of hate, so Caprice, interns and Jackson are there to throw one back in. The deck has Trick of Light so you're not solely dependent upon the archology.

Economy is operation based and Gila Hands + Archology if that ever gets set up and you're waiting on agendas. There's not many reasons to have two advancement counters on the archology so you might as well use one if you get one to, say, Double Gila Hands or Gila Hands -> Celebrity Gift. I've gone for mid-range ice but I'm not sold on this configuration...apart from the Ice Walls. Those things are gold in Tenshin institute. They're powerful trick-of-light batteries early game.

Some notes: currently there's not much Jinteki burn cards like Shock! Not sure if I want to change that to give a better criminal matchup or to improve R&D defenses. Still not sure about the ice makeup but it feels pretty good. Some weakness to parasite but this deck can generate fairly consistent money. I'm presently tweeking the Agenda suite: I haven't tested it with Medical Breakthrough but I feel it can do well. Also if you score a Predictions you get a pretty much guarrenteed 1-turn window to push through another agenda. Previously the deck had Rainbow to try and exploit this but I didn't really like Rainbow's other drawbacks so Bastions replaced them.

name: CT Speed CE
Continually Always Watching
description: Just wanted to do something a bit ridiculous by having a deck just run Overmind which means running mostly hardware to get as much memory as possible, then recur Overmind. I know it's impractical but I always wanted a hardware deck and replicator is actually useful (also maybe inside man if I play around with it)

name: Notoriety Quest
description: Run, Kenma, run! This was my first Honor and Profit build. I LOL'd IRL when my league-mate brought the Silhouette take on this to our league event, and then we both LOL'd when someone won Chicago Regionals with a clone of his build :). It's pretty strong, mostly because notoriety and QC are lateral / orthogonal threats. That said I'm not sure how it fares against a build that can lock down centrals.

name: Iain controls your economy (at least for a while)
Blossoms from the Red Planet
description: They are all... in development. A Tennin version of Cherry Blossoms, my delightful ronin/breaker-beater JRP deck.

name: Gardens of Pain and Deceit
description: Caprice's Nisei Division. I heavily tested a punitive/closed accounts version, but it was only fair. I don't win psi games much even though I roll a d3!

name: Overknight 1.0
description:
A massive amount of synergy in this deck.

Deep Red and Dyson Mem Chip to provide 6+ counters on Overmind -- more than enough. On large ice, use Knight.

Recurse Knight and Overmind with Pawn and Clone Chip. If needed, Scavenge an empty Scheherazade.

Scheherazade+Pawn engine to gain cards and credits. LLDS Processor to reduce the cost of running with a fresh Overmind.

Install 1 Dyson Mem Chip to trigger Underworld Contact.

name: Leakmail v1.0
description:
Attempted to create an Andromeda deck that utilizes both Data Leak Reversal and Blackmail. Essentially, an attempt to mill the corp out of cards using Data Leak Reversal, tag gain via John Masanori and Snitch, removal via Crash Space, then waltz in with Blackmail. Snitch is useful as it allows you to make unsuccessful runs on servers that have been iced up without rezzing said ice. Otherwise, simply running and not accessing unprotected remotes can count as an unsuccessful run.

In the end, it turned out being effective at getting all the combo pieces together, however the overall concept is very slow. Could use The Source, however Influence is already a bit tight with needing all the card advantage to find combo pieces quickly.

name: Silhouette - Notorious centrals Doppleganger
description:
Relatively simple deck. Centrals only breakers leading to milling R&D for agendas, the Femmes used to neutralise high cost sentries or other problem ice, the scavenges designed to reposition the femmes to allow me to access what the runner thinks are safe remotes quickly if needed. New Angeles enables me to avoid the tags from account siphon and keep Ms. Jones safe. Doppleganger allows multiple runs (i.e. double R&D runs) which also increases the chance of scoring a notoriety or two, something that irritates harmony medtech no end and goes a long way towards countering the pains of Shi-Kyu. It can struggle a bit late game especially once the corp has realised you are running centrals only, something Kati Jones goes a long way towards countering, but at that point, you can easily trash Jacksons where needed and out dig the corps draw from R&D.

I used to run emergency shutdown in it, but discovered I wasn't really using it at all, so threw New Angeles City Hall in instead to counter tag punishment. I ditched account siphon from the original deck, as I realised I just wasn't actually using it at all. Tempted to ditch forged activation orders too as I don't seem to actually get anything useful out of it, except prior knowledge for femme placement.

name: Call the T.O., Iain is Slow-Playing
description: Response to 'what would big rig criminal look like'. This is very much so intended to be a slow play deck, and made in about 10 minutes. No influence used, just trying to make a skeleton to get the scuff removed.

name: Fatale Atman 3.0
description:
General premise is Datasucker deck with Femme Fatale's, Atmans and Parasites.

Changers form 2.0

Parasite down 1 for SMC to free up some influence without hindering my parasiting 2 much.

Gordian Blade gone finding little use for it and costs 2 much to have it. Stimhack added for surprise runs when low on cash works well with clone chip and SMC too.

1 grim changed for a desperado the extra cash will be useful but i like the memory and extra virus tokens from grim running both gives me the option from game to game (in Theory anyway).

Snowball changed for Inti snowball costs too much for the little use i get out of it and with datasuckers its just as useful

name: For the love of Ash v3 H&P added
Nauty Secrets 3.0
description:
The Idea of this deck is to stop the hacker getting through and load up free advancements on Ice Wall for Trick of Light & Commercialization.

Using Tick of light for some fast advancements otherwise use the never advance rule for scoring.

Taken out the san-san's and changed the approach to a never advance approach. Found a lot of the ICE too weak or too costly to res so used more influence on ICE hopefully for better tax & stopping power.

Comments welcome

name: Professor Oracle
description: First deck I started messing with. Was unhappy with predictability of resource generating cards so I tried to increase it to 20% from 16.

name: Personal Devolution 2
description: any resemblence to any deck living or dead is purely coincidental

name: Red Coats HM
description: My preferred Red Coats build at the moment. God I hate this archetype, but it's an important gauntlet deck to know and to play against.

name: CT Overmind
Whizzard's Assault
description:
My take on a Joshua B./DLR deck. You're still very aggressive, but you have a little flexibility in your events and influence thanks to Planned Assault, then recur those events with Same Old Thing. It may be more efficient to replace Planned Assault with another Account Siphon, but I think it'll be useful to be able to tutor for events like Legwork when you need them.

Other than that, its a pretty standard breaker/program/resource/hardware suite.

name: Ken Tenma il Disperato
Noise reborn ver 1.09 Cube 22/05/14 Second Place
description: My anarch deck form our mini local tournament (10ppl). I added the indexing just before the tournament but sadly didn’t draw it and I got Siphon only once during all the games but did play it few times with same old and déjà vu ;) I must say that in my opinion anarchist are difficult to play and one needs some time to get used to runnig with them.

name: jinteki ver 2.01 Cube 22/05/14 Second Place
description: My jinteki deck form our mini local tournament (10ppl). Fun to play, all games that I manage the win where flatlines, tbh only agenda I scored was House of Knives

name: Criminal Mill
description:
The idea here is to eventually get out the following combo: John Masanori, Data Leak Reversal, Crash Space. After that combo is out, you can simply bounce off of a harmless server, click twice to trash two cards from R&D, then remove the tag obtained from John Masanori with Crash Space. Notice no credits were spent. Every turn you can mill two cards from R&D or three if you played an Early Bird.

Either mill the corp to death or more likely make a run on archives when there is a nice stack of milled cards in it.

The almost fool-proof way to make a run on archives: Blackmail

If corp doesn't have bad publicity yet play an Activist Support with New Angeles City Hall or a couple Fall Guys to prevent the Activist Support from getting trashed.

A couple of nice side affects:

1) For your milling turns you are not making any successful runs (no worry about those operations that state: if the runner made a successful run last turn...).

2) Crash Space also protects against meat damage

name: Philotic Pain 1.1
description:
What is going on here? Why so many agendas? Why so much pain? Everything hurts here...and the runner will suffer to get a single agenda point. More agendas in his score area, more dangerous Philotic Entanglemnt gets. Forces him to add some Shi.Kyu there and we are in for a threat. You dont have too much eco cards because you dont need. Score what you can fast, go crazy in remotes, lay traps and always try to put these future perfects in your archives. NEVER INSTALL IT. Go, and kill the pesky runner.

Added Fast Track (amazing to push the runner to its limits onceyou fast track a philotic) and Shiro (amazing way to avoid Philotic from being stolen)

name: Tennin Winstitute
Pension Plan (Connected Iain v1.1)
description:
This was the original deck that wanted to use Theophilius Bagbiter plus Kati Jones and/or Calling in Favors in the same turn, in order to get some EHP.

Try to be ready to start making runs immediately after corp gains first agenda. Try your best not to make any runs unless they're attacking corp econ or gaining you information about ICE placement because if you score an agenda, you're going to sacrifice several turns of getting 2 credits per turn.

Using Underworld Contact along with Stirling's ability means you get 5c at the start of each turn, which is pretty nuts.

Try to wait for Calling in Favors until you have 4+ connections installed.

This is not to make a lot of runs; the hope is to force corp to hold onto agendas in HQ then hit HQ really hard at the end.

Maybe this deck is too order dependent. You want

  1. Any Connections before CIFavors

  2. Dyson Mem Chip before Overmind and Underworld Contact

If you get Logos out early enough for it to go off, try to fish out Professional Contacts or The Helpful AI (if you dont have any link yet).

When the corp scores his first agenda, put on your best old man voice and say to yourself, "It's about time, Stirling".

name: Chaos Draw
description:
Not much description here yet. It funnels econ through pre-paids for quite effective money generation, especially on the 2nd run through the deck.

Draw like crazy, don't be afraid to discard, then eventually get your breaker suite setup. I haven't solved the problem of it being too slow yet, so if anybody has ideas....

name: Teltin v0.2 alpha
description:
Named after Mass Effect's facility where Cerberus kept Jack when she was a child. A very nasty place with some very nasty secrets. Just like this deck, hopefully.

I haven't playtested it yet, so these strategy tips might just be a load of nonsense, but hey, I tried my best.

You should play one Medical Breakthrough (MB from now on) very early game (doesn't matter if gets stolen or scored) because the Runner getting those two early points isn't that big of a deal thanks to MB's ability.

Adonis and Melange to get some cash mid-game. You probably only need one of those in play at any given time but they give you different options. Putting some taxing ICE (Pup, Rainbow and maybe Swordsman to take three or four credits out of the Runner) in front of them might even get you an economic advantage. Also, Beanstalk Royalties and Green Level Clearance are always nice, no matter when they come up. A couple of Hedge Funds to try to work around v0.1's lack of early-game economy.

The Junebugs are there to get the mind games running. A Mushin No Shin - Junebug combo at the right time can win a match.

Tori Hanzo might get played alongside Komainu but it's not a central part of the deck. Same goes for Susanoo-No-Mikoto.

The psi cards seem like a lot of fun to play with. Don't know if they'll make it into my tournament decks but they are fantastic flavour for this deck. Caprice Nisei can save your butt or act as bait. Psychic Field is just nasty. Awesome card. Took out a Cerebral Cast and added another Snare! Jinteki's good ole nasty surprise.

I have some concerns about the amount of cards. 48 just seems three or four too many cards and I'll just have to cut some corners here and there (say, get rid of the tagging part).

Well, that's about it. Enjoy.

name: The Grey Coats
description: An attempt to adapt the Red Coats style of deep, taxing ice to a new faction that specializes in such ice: Weyland. Economy is provided by the strong assets and the inclusion of GRNDL Refinery, which doubles as an install-advance-advance bluff to open a potential scoring window.

name: Shutdown Tennin
description: Try to do the Tennin thing--with a bit of help from program trashing.

name: Generic NBN
Kit's Busy Day
description:
First published deck! I've been rather pleased with the way this has been performing, so I thought it was time to get some feedback on it.

Inspiration for the deck came from this thread: http://www.reddit.com/r/Netrunner/comments/263wru/deckchaostheorynotessentialoraclemay/

There are three parts to this deck.

The first is Oracle May; she more or less provides us with 2 credits and a card every turn. Guess "event" each time, seeing as how there are 36 of them in here (except if you used Test Run the previous turn!).

The second is Prepaid VoicePAD/Lucky Find/Dirty Laundry/Sure Gamble. Lots of money, and more if you can put the VoicePADs on the table before they're trashed by May.

The third is Kit/Test Run/Scavenge. Because we're playing Kit, a Test Run into a Torch means we can probably shut down early scoring attempts behind a single piece of ICE. If we're in a pinch, playing Test Run by itself is okay; on the next turn, guess "program" then use Modded to install whatever it was.

Getting May out early is essential. The next priority should be getting Torch out, then building the rest of your rig as need be. We've got three LARLAs, so drawing through the deck with Diesel and Quality Time should be okay.
